DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense1Level.Sm: Low level indicates that the contents of the dispenser should be refilled soon.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense2Level.Sm: Low level indicates that the contents of the dispenser should be refilled soon.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_CycleStatusCleanReminder.Smar: Indicates when it's time to run a Clean Washer with affresh® cycle.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense1Level.En: Load & Go™ Dispenser 1 is running low. Refill it soon or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 1 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense2Level.Wa: Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 is running low. Refill it soon or disable it and Dispenser 1 will be used.
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 is running low. Refill it soon or fabric softener won't be used.
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_OpStatusBulkDispense2Level.En: Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 is running low. Refill it soon or disable it and Dispenser 1 will be used.
Your Load & Go™ Dispenser 2 level is currently good. When your dispenser has run out, you will need to refill it or disable it to add detergent to the drum directly.
DDMLiterals.WashCavity_CycleStatusCleanReminder.Desc: Clean periodically to prevent odors. Select 'Clean Washer' cycle below.

F0,E1.Name: Load detected in clean washer cycle
F0,E1.Description: Load detected in clean washer cycle.
StepsToRepair: Remove load and re-start Clean Washer cycle.

F0,E2.Name: Oversuds/Water Ring detection
F0,E2.Description: Excessive sudsing. Suds reduction routine running.
StepsToRepair: Allow washer to continue.
Use only HE detergent.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F0E2

F0,E3.Name: Over Temperature on Dry unit/No air Flow
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F0E3.

F0,E4.Name: Over Temperature on Wash unit
StepsToRepair: Should be connected to cold water supply.
If plumbed correctly and problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F0E4

F0,E5.Name: Off balance load detected – unable to recovery
StepsToRepair: In Use & Care Guide see “Cycle Guide” and “Using Your Washer.”
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F0E5.

F1,E4.Name: Main relay error – short - safety
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F1E4.

F3,E1.Name: Pressure Sensor out of range
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F3E1.

F3,E2.Name: Wash NTC failure – short
F3,E2.Description: Drying system error. Washer operable but will not dry.
StepsToRepair: Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F3E3

F3,E3.Name: Air Inlet NTC failure – short
F3,E3.Description: Drying system error. Washer operable but will not dry.
StepsToRepair: Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F3E3

F3,E4.Name: ADS error – sensors
StepsToRepair: Clean bulk detergent dispenser.
Measure and add detergent manually until repairs are made.
Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F3E4.

F4,E2.Name: Dry heater circuit failure – short – safety
F4,E2.Description: Drying system error. Washer operable but will not dry.
StepsToRepair: Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F4E2

F4,E3.Name: Blower motor TRIAC short
F4,E3.Description: Drying system error. Washer operable but will not dry.
StepsToRepair: Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F4E3

F5,E1.Name: Door switch closed and unlocked during running mode (Door detected unlocked when should be locked)
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F5E1

F5,E2.Name: Door lock not lock
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F5E2

F5,E3.Name: Door lock not unlock
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F5E3

F5,E4.Name: Door not opened between cycles
StepsToRepair: Make sure to open and close the washer/dryer door between cycles.

F6,E1.Name: ACU – MCU communication failure (heartbeat) detected by MCU
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F6E1.

F6,E2.Name: ACU – HMI communication failure (heart beat)
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F6E2.

F6,E3.Name: Cycle not supported by EEPROM
StepsToRepair: If power cord accessible try resetting machine by unplugging and replugging machine power to wall outlet.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F6E3.

F8,E1.Name: Inlet water closed/Valve failure/Fill timeout
StepsToRepair: Be sure home water supply is turned on.
Check for kinks in water supply hose.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F8E1.

F8,E3.Name: Overflow detected
StepsToRepair: Schedule service: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777. Service code: F8E3

F9,E1.Name: Drain timeout/Pump failure
StepsToRepair: Check drain pump filter.
Make sure bellow drain holes and standpipe are clear.
If problem persists: In the U.S.A. 1-800-253-1301; In Canada 1-800-807-6777 for service. Service code: F9E1.

NestSettings.NestHome.Name: Nest™ Home 1
NestSettings.HomeCombo.Name: Home Combo
NestSettings.WrinkleShield.Name: Wrinkle Shield™
NestSettings.WrinkleShield.Description: When your Nest sends an Away signal to your phone, your dryer will start the Wrinkle Shield™ feature once it is done running.  Away signal may take up to two hours.
NestSettings.QuietWhileHome.Name: Quiet While Home
NestSettings.QuietWhileHome.Description: Your dryer will automatically go into quiet mode when your nest is set to Home.
NestSettings.FanFresh.Name: Fresh While Away
NestSettings.FanFresh.Description: When your Nest sends an Away signal to your phone, your washer will start the TumbleDry™ feature.  Away signal may take up to two hours.
NestSettings.SmartEnergy.Name: Smart Energy
NestSettings.SmartEnergy.Description: If enabled by your energy provider, the All-In-One will set an automatic delay start so that your appliance will not run during peak energy hours.

DetergentDispenser.Name: Detergent Dispenser
DetergentDispenser.Description: Turns automatic dosing on and off

DetergentConcentration.Name: Detergent Concentration
DetergentConcentration.Description: Allow user to adjust the concentration level of detergent they are using

Status.Name: Status
Status.Description: This button launches a picker allowing the user to select Active or Inactive, effectively turning dispensing on/off

Content.Name: Content
Content.Description: This button launches a picker allowing the user to change the chamber between Detergent and Softener

QuiteMode.Name: Quite Mode
QuiteMode.Description: Toggles quiet mode on and off.

ControlLock.Name: Control Lock Enabled/Disabled
ControlLock.Description: Toggles the control lock feature on and off. Control lock toggle is disabled and inactive when appliance is running.

DryOnly.Name: Dry Only
DryOnly.Description: Allows you to skip the wash cycle.

WashDryTransition.Name: Washing Complete
WashDryTransition.Description: When running wash+dry cycle, provide a notification when wash cycle is complete. Inform consumer that unit is moving into drying phase and they have the ability to pause the cycle.

MachineCleaningWipes.Name: affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes
MachineCleaningWipes.Description: Keeping your washer looking like new is easy, thanks to the versatility of affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes—the strongest and thickest washing machine cleaning wipe available. Featuring dual-sided durability, a clean lemongrass scent and Micro-Grab™ fibers that visibly lift and lock in residue, dirt and dust from machine surfaces, no other washing machine wipe cleans better.
MachineCleaningWipes.Disclaimer: Keeping your washer looking like new is easy, thanks to the versatility of affresh® Machine Cleaning Wipes—the strongest and thickest washing machine cleaning wipe available. Featuring dual-sided durability, a clean lemongrass scent and Micro-Grab™ fibers that visibly lift and lock in residue, dirt and dust from machine surfaces, no other washing machine wipe cleans better.

MachineCleanerTablets6count.Name: affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner Tablets – 6 count
MachineCleanerTablets6count.Description: Did you know that your washing machine needs a wash of its own? That’s why each affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner tablet is specially formulated to help keep your washing machine performing and looking like new. Simply drop a tablet in for a clean with confidence.
MachineCleanerTablets6count.Disclaimer: Did you know that your washing machine needs a wash of its own? That’s why each affresh® Washing Machine Cleaner tablet is specially formulated to help keep your washing machine performing and looking like new. Simply drop a tablet in for a clean with confidence.

SmartTip.Content: Smart All-In-One Washer & Dryer estimates the amount of supplies remaining and targets the right time to order necessities so your family always has what they need to do laundry.
